metadata.title: USN-6467-1 -- Kerberos vulnerability
metadata.description: Robert Morris discovered that Kerberos did not properly handle memory access when processing RPC data through kadmind, which could lead to the freeing of uninitialized memory. An authenticated remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause kadmind to crash, resulting in a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6467-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libkadm5srv-mit9 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 libkadm5srv-mit8 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 libk5crypto3 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 krb5-user - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 libgssrpc4 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 libkrb5support0 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 krb5-doc - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 libkrb5-dev - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 krb5-pkinit - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 libkrb5-3 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 krb5-otp - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 libkadm5clnt-mit9 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 krb5-gss-samples - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 krb5-multidev - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 krb5-locales - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 krb5-kdc - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 libkrad-dev - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 libkrad0 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 libkdb5-7 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 krb5-admin-server - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm4 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
